On the first day of 2021, I had the intention of writing an article of a summary nature, unsuccessfully.
There are many reasons for this, the main one being that the past four months have been so unsuccessful that rushing around can only produce words that are heavily emotional. So choose to do a summary (and of course “outlook”) today after almost three months is the most appropriate.
At the beginning of the idea, I tried to sort out the time in my head, but I gave up before I was halfway through. As Alex Chiof SJTU of self-deprecatingly put it: “My failure was mediocre “. But the difference is that my failure is also monotonous in the eyes of mediocre people. So the final decision is to write wherever I can think of.
Memoirs (Confessions) Anything that happens can always be traced back (a long time) to a series of decisions, and the subjects who make decisions are non-independent individuals shaped by a series of experiences, so the real sense of “traceability” should at least be the birth of the studied individuals. This is obviously a pipe dream, and I do not have the idea or capital to write an autobiography. Common sense dictates that the most appropriate anchor point would be one morning in mid-August – the day I awoke from a dream at 10:30 a.m. and automatically gave up the opportunity to study at a university in Macau on time. Then sleepy-eyed I opened zhihu casual browsing, inadvertently found the truth taht Chongqing University of Posts and Telecommunications' software engineering program in Chongqing and some areas is the second batch of admission.
A self-directed nightmare began sparingly.
Beginning of the semester (Start) The flight from Jinan to Chongqing took about two and half an hours. the dark, hazy cabin and continuous noise kept pulling me back to reality, urging me to think and plan about my future life. Having unanimously passed on the U.S.-based transfer program just before boarding, the man who in the “escape plan vacuum” decided to wait and see for a while and make a self-help self-congratulation – “After all, students in Shandong don’t have restrictions on changing their major”, “Even if I can’t change my major, my efforts for four years won’t be that bad”. The family had a lot of fun in the following days, at least not since the second grade.
Then we moved into the dormitory, class meetings, received textbooks, classes, and group building. The English class was very relaxed, except for the group communication, which was a lot of work; I won’t comment on the rest of the class. It was not until some computer practice class started, and then programming fundamentals were on the schedule, that everything changed.
Mid-semester (Development) No one wants to read too many complaints, and I don’t want to write them, and in case any of the words poke the “soft spot” of people who have an impact on my future plans, it’s not good. The general situation is that everything is not as simple as it seems, and the problem is not something that can be solved simply by effort, not to mention that I am not the kind of person with high enough execution. When the subjective individual character flaws and objective conditions of the dirty place fit perfectly, the poor guy is like a giant beast caught in a tar pit, pretending to struggle to find the deeper you fall, simply listen to God and enjoy the fall.
It still seems like an exaggeration to say that.
Fortunately, I have found a good way to escape – “Datsu-A Ron”.
The cause was pretty tame, probably from some OIer in a similar situation who heard that it was possible to apply to a German university using “Gaokao” results. I looked at it and felt it was good, and the parents looked at it and felt it was feasible. Anyway, the matter was on the agenda.
After that, I was surprised to find that college life was so easy. If you don’t want to “Baoyan”, you don’t have to participate in all kinds of strange competitions (such as the Mathematical Model and Blue Bridge Cup, especially the latter is amazingly low); if you don’t want to “Kaoyan”, it’s not necessary for you to spend too much time on politics; if you don’t want to get a scholarship, you don’t have to participate in all kinds of volunteer activities to get the HOURS. All unnecessary activities can be put off as soon as possible. Not active? Yes! I’m not active! (proud face)
In short, everything is on the right track by mistake. Whether this is the right path or not, but I believe that in this university now this professional rules four years out is certainly not to achieve the goal. After three years of junior high school and three years of high school, I really do not want to experience this self-imposed exile, and I do not want to use “see reality”, “gradually mature” arguments to beautify my own degradation.
I got my first APS after midterms, and had to wait a long time for the remaining nine due to the epidemic (I got them at home in February ‘21). All in all everything was moving along smoothly and I experienced a sense of security that I had lacked for a long time.
End of semester (milestone) Content omitted.
Ending Words Content omitted.
Plans during undergraduate（Bechelor）period Content invisible.
summary: On the first day of 2021, I had the intention of writing an article of a summary nature, unsuccessfully.
title: Summary and Planning 01

content:
The defer keyword is found in many modern programming languages, and Go’s defer executes the passed-in function before the current function or method returns. It is often used to close file descriptors, close database connections, and unlock resources.
When it comes to keyword defer in go, I felt confused.
The teacher showed a piece of code:
1 2 3 4 5 6 7  func main() { i := 1 defer fmt.Println(i + 1) i++ fmt.Println("hello, world!") }   I thought that it must print "hello, world!" and 3 at first. But after typing and runing, I was totally shocked —— It’s output is "hello, world" and 2!
What actually gets printed as a two, because that i +1 is evaluated right there when the first statement, when it hits the differed statement, the i +1 is evaluated and at that time, i is a one, so i +1 is a two. So, later when the differed statement actually gets executed it’s still prints a two.
summary: The defer keyword is found in many modern programming languages, and Go’s defer executes the passed-in function before the current function or method returns. It is often used to close file descriptors, close database connections, and unlock resources.
title: Defer in Golang

content:
In previous assignment, I was asked to implement a function which can pick the biggest number in a slice.
By learning on Coursera, I found a better way to do this.
Ordinary Method When I started learning Programming in C++, the text book told me that the best way to pick the biggest number in an array is like this:
1 2 3 4 5 6 7  int getMax(int *a, int len) { int flag = a[0]; for (int i = 1; i < len; ++i) if (a[i] > flag) flag = a[i]; return flag }   It’s simple, understandable and efficient. I cannot find a better algorithm to work as well as this (in C++).
The “Better” Way in Golang At the beginning, I wrote a same function as usual in Go like this:
1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9  func getMax(arr []int, n int) int { var flag int = arr[0] for i := 1; i < n; i++ { if arr[i] > flag { flag = arr[i] } } return flag }   Ok, I had completed the task perfectly. But I learned a new way to do the same thing elegantly. Furthermore, it uses some excellent features like ruby. Now let me show you the code.
1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9  func getMax(vals ...int) int { flag := MINN for _, v range vals { if v > flag { flag = v } } return flag }   ... is a powerful sign and widely used in Go(and very very misleading). It can unfold slices and arrays.
After writing this post, I suddenly felt it was nothing. I can write this function more beautiful by using another languages.
Starting with C++ does really restrict my mind.Every time I use languages such as ruby, I felt like dancing with tight feet. It’s bad.
That’s all, thank you. I felt worse.
summary:
In previous assignment, I was asked to implement a function which can pick the biggest number in a slice.

By learning on Coursera, I found a better way to do this.
title: A better way to implement getMax() in Golang

The article shows several ways to elegantly share source code
Ubuntu Paste: Simple, but practical 在上图我贴了一份C++代码，可以看到：有高亮且支持大部分语言（Clojure这类冷门语言都支持的！），可复制还可以直接download（下载需要登陆账号）
除了界面比较朴素，高亮的主题、字体有年代感外，这是极其优秀的贴代码方式，比拍照、直接复制粘贴好到不知道那里去
而且短短一行链接，也不会再聊天室里刷屏，体验极佳！
你可以点击这个链接查看上图的代码，体会体会qwq
下面我简单说明一下如何使用：
  “Poster” 就是贴代码的你，可以随意填写
  “Syntax” 语法，这直接关系到代码高亮能不能正常显示，所以请认真选择
  “Expiration” 过期时间，None就是永远不会失效，如果有需求可以选择销毁时间
  “Content” 就是你要贴的内容啦！！
  填写完后，点击Paste！就可以把代码贴出去了
Carbon.now.sh: Modern and powerful Ubuntu Paste知道的人太多了！如果只说它一个的话就相当于水了一篇文章
下面要介绍的Carbon.now.sh，也就是header page展示的那张，，，可以说非常的优雅
正如主页所说：
 Create and share beautiful images of your source code.
 使用方法也很简单，傻瓜式的方式很方便
亮点是可以直接发推！！而且可以输出图片
效果图：
大概能理解好多项目主页上的图片是怎么弄得了
不仅如此，在超多的主题之外，你还可以自定义自己的主题
可以说是非常方便了！
